text: @PghWeatherDude Extreme weather events are pretty consistent.  We avg 9 days of -15F and 9 days +15F departure from mean per 1874-2000, from 2000-2020 one less -15F day and same +15F day.  It is cloudier and more precipitation which is indicative of a warmer atmosphere.

We used stochastic weather generators to reassemble observed daily weather in an extreme but plausible way. Yiou and Jézéquel used these SWGs to simulate extreme heatwaves. Here the SWGs had to be adapted to simulate warm winter periods and extended precipitation events.

La Nina causes drought in our region. Afghanistan has experienced extreme decrease in precipitation. Snowpack coverage for January of 2021 shows signifcant decrease in extent and depth of snow over Hindokush from previous year. This is clear sign of drought ahead. https://t.co/oM1gRTp0xo
